alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; Winn (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 2:36AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Caldwell and northeastern Winn Parishes through 330 AM CDT... At 235 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Buckner to near Columbia to 7 miles west of Clarks to 13 miles northeast of Winnfield. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Clarks, Grayson, Spaulding, Riverton, Kelly and Burlington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
